intro: Geum montanorivale, commonly known as the mountain stream buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils along streams and in mountain meadows. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are usually hairy. Geum montanorivale is often found in high-altitude environments where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
